articles.description: An increasing number of reports have observed strange symptoms in patients infected with the novel coronavirus, including blood clotting. Clotting can lead to strokes and heart attacks, and a new study says that blood-thinning drugs may reduce the risk of dea…
articles.content:

articles.title: Coronavirus: New study reveals which lockdown measures could be safely lifted first - Sky News
articles.description: Scientists suggest relaxing stay-at-home orders and allowing some shops to reopen should be the first steps taken to end lockdown.

articles.author: Ryan Smith
articles.title: Forty-one new coronavirus cases in Sunderland as North East total jumps by 249 - Sunderland Echo
articles.description: Eight new cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Sunderland as a further five patients under the care of the city’s NHS Trust die after contracting the illness.
articles.content:
Across the North East region, there are now 8,804 confirmed cases of Covid-19 a rise of 160 from Thursday, May 7 according to the latest figures released on Friday, May 8.
In the UK, 211,364 people have tested positive for the virus; an increase of 4,649 in … [+3543 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: People line the streets of Campbeltown in tribute to paramedic - BBC News
articles.description: The funeral of Robert Black, who died after testing positive for Covid-19, is held in Campbeltown.
articles.content:
Image copyrightPA MediaImage caption
 The cortege was escorted by a paramedic on motorbike
Local people have paid their respects to a paramedic who died after testing positive for Covid-19.
They lined pavements in Campbeltown for the funeral cortege carryi… [+1232 chars]

articles.content:
A PUBLIC health professor has warned that the Scottish Government’s strategy to escape the lockdown will encounter “a big problem” unless test results can be provided quicker.

articles.title: UK coronavirus live: Johnson tells cabinet they will adopt 'maximum caution' as they move to end lockdown - The Guardian
articles.description: ONS says risk of death significantly higher among some ethnic groups than others; Sturgeon will consider allowing more outdoor exercise; Johnson to give speech on lockdown plans at 7pm on Sunday
articles.content:
Nicola Sturgeon has confirmed she sees no case for relaxing Scotlands strict lockdown regulations on Monday because she believes the countrys coronavirus transmission rate is still worryingly high.
